contentList.content: Pained Domain
Can't spell dopamine without Pained Domain.
Autosadism

When you are hit by an attack, you can choose to take an additional amount of damage equal to your Constitution <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag> plus your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and heal allied entities within [1]m for the same amount.

It's the cruel beast that you feed
It's your burning yearning need to bleed
Through the spillways of your soul
 - Spillways, Ghost
Exhibitionist
The limelight burns so good. You gain an extra <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction point</LSTag>.
Extortionist
When you attack an enemy afflicted with Thumbscrewed, you deal an extra [1].
In Pain in the Membrane
You gain a +1 to Constitution and Wisdom, but -1 to Intelligence.
Show Some Skin

Your skin is supple and used to pain. You gain an extra health point for each character level. While not wearing armour, your base <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> becomes 12, plus your Wisdom and Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifiers</LSTag> to your Armour Class.
Thumbscrewer
If you are unarmed and not wearing armor, you deal an extra [1] with your unarmed attacks and add your Proficiency Bonus to their attack rolls.
Thumbscrews

When you make a critical strike against an enemy, you afflict them with <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KHB_Status_Thumbscrewed">Thumbscrewed</LSTag>. Your <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> threshold is reduced by [1].
Flaying Strikes
Your desire to inflict pain lets your unarmed attacks strike much harder. Your unarmed attacks deal an extra [1].

Your desire to inflict pain lets your unarmed attacks strike much harder. Your unarmed attacks deal an extra [1], and count as magical for the purpose of overcoming enemies' <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> to non-magical damage.
Flay Nerves

Once per turn, forcefully attack and apply <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KHB_Status_Thumbscrewed">Thumbscrewed</LSTag> to your target for [1] rounds, fraying their nerves and shocking their system with the sudden pain. They are <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to all damage until the start of your next turn.

Once per turn, forcefully attack and apply <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KHB_Status_Thumbscrewed">Thumbscrewed</LSTag> to your target for [1] rounds, fraying their nerves and shocking their system with the sudden pain. They are <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to all damage until the start of your next turn. Damage done by this attack counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming enemies' <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Immune">Immunity</LSTag> to non-magical damage.
Offering to Loviatar
Thumbscrewed
Target has been pierced and is actively suffering pain from Thumbscrews. Their AC is lowered by [1].
Flayed Nerves

Target has been forcibly overstimulated by your excruciating skill and the pain of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="KHB_Status_Thumbscrewed">Thumbscrewed</LSTag>. They are <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to all damage.
Loviatar

Loviatar was the evil goddess of agony and was both queen and servant to the greater god Bane. The Maiden of Pain was the master of inflicting physical and psychological suffering, her portfolio encompassing hurt and torture.

I sat alone because of thy hand, for thou hast filled me with indignation. Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuseth to be healed? Wilt thou be altogether unto me as a liar, and as waters that fail? - Maiden of Pain, Kameron M. Franklin
